com.kolbly.mortgagecomparer.db
Class DataManager

java.lang.Object
  com.kolbly.mortgagecomparer.db.DataManager

public final class DataManager
extends java.lang.Object

Application's data manager

A singleton instance to be used for all database access

Author:
mkolbly

create

public static DataManager create(android.content.Context context,
                                 java.lang.String name,
                                 android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase.CursorFactory factory,
                                 int version)
Create a DataManager

Useful for unit testing

Parameters:
context - to use to open or create the database
name - of the database file, or null for an in-memory database
factory - to use for creating cursor objects, or null for the default
version - number of the database (starting at 1)
Returns:
newly minted DataManager (non-singleton)
See Also:
DataManager(Context, String, android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase.CursorFactory, int)

getDbName

public java.lang.String getDbName()
Get the database name

Note: We're not using android.database.sqlite.getDatabaseName() since it only was available starting at API level 14

getUser

public User getUser()
Get the first user in the database

For this version, there will be only 1 user so we'll always operate on the first user in the User table

Returns:
User from database or null if not found

save

public boolean save(DbRow data)
Save the data to the database table

If the id == 0, then inserts a new row of data and then updates the data's id to the newly inserted identity value

If the id > 0, then updates the existing data in the database

Parameters:
data - Database data to save
Returns:
true on success

delete

public boolean delete(DbRow data)

Parameters:
data - Database data to update
Returns:
true on success

update

Update an existing row of data in the database

Parameters:
data - Database data to update
Returns:
true on success

insert

public boolean insert(DbRow data)
Insert a new row of data in the database

Side Effect: Updates the id of data with the newly inserted row identity

Parameters:
data - Database data to insert
Returns:
true on success
